Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: BluIreland
Reviews.Content: Great location, just 10 min walk from the train station and no problem to find, just off Dam Square. Arrived on early flight, booked a double room but as they had a twin available on arrival opted for this, as we were tierd, although located to the front of the hotel. Construction work on street, underground being built, so dont expect it to be quiet dring working hours. room was small but spotless, sheets were pretty worn, one had holes in it and also two of the towels, this is not good enough as we were payin 65.00eur pps per night B&B. I did not complain, as i think they should know themselves without it having to be pointed out, a hole is a hole at the end of the day, you wouldnt have it at home and as i was so tierd when i arrived i couldnt be bothered. Breakfast was Excellent, lovely and fresh. Staff were all lovely and helpful. i would definatly stay here again and recomend it. Location and staff would bring me back.

Reviews.Title: “Rokin Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: bebelutel
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, but not so great value for money

Reviews.Title: “New Year in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: DavieAndAudrey
Reviews.Content: Flight time from Glasgow around 65 mins Transfer time from Airport to hotel around 20 minutes by Taxi - cost 50 Euros Bedroom - Our room was room 36 located on the 3rd floor at the back of the hotel. The room was very small but spotless, it was cleaned every day. The bedding was a little worn but it didn't take away from the comfortable beds - really soft. It had 2 single beds pushed together, unfortunately, at the head of the bed was a BIG wooden "rafter beam" right in between them which we smacked our heads off a few times... not the best! There was a safe (at no extra charge) a small wardrobe and a desk/chair. There was a 22" LCD TV with BBC1 and a music channel but no other English speaking channels. Checkout is between 7 & 11am but they are happy to keep your bags for you and reception will happily book you a taxi if you need one for the airport etc.. You could hear other holiday makers in the rooms above / beside you - but it wasn't enough to put us off the hotel. Bathroom - Bathroom was small but functional, it was basically a "wet room", unfortunately... this ALSO had the ever present rafter beams inside the showers which (if you are over 5 foot 6) you'd smack your head off too! :-/ , the water pressure was good even at times when there was high usage. There was a hair dryer and 2 bath & 2 hand towels. There was also complimentary shampoo, shower gel, and soap. There is a lift, it goes from the ground floor to the 3rd floor. So.. if you are on the 4th floor and when going to/from breakfast in the basement, you need to go up and down a flight of steep stairs. The staff were all really friendly and happy to help with any queries / directions etc. Reception is 24 hours. Breakfast was really nice - offering bacon and eggs, cheeses and cold meats etc, There was toast, pancakes cereals - basically what you'd expect from a continental hotel. WIFI - there was access to free WIFI from anywhere in the hotel giving really good coverage. There was also the use of a PC in main reception too if you wanted it at no extra charge. Location - About 2 minutes walk from Dam square and about 10 from the red light district, about 15 minutes walk from Central station. Walking in the other direction, you are about 10 minutes from Rembrandt square too - The hotel is in a great location, right in the middle of things without being in your face. There was lots of noise from the digging/drilling outside the hotel early in the morning, where they are building a subway, it wasn't as bad as you'd think to be honest but not likely to be finished till 2015 ish. It wouldn't put me off staying here. Overall we enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would likely use it again. Amsterdam is a fantastic place to visit and this hotels location makes it ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and price.”
Reviews.Author: jwcostello
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, marvellous breakfast buffet, clean and spacious rooms with comfortable beds and friendly and attentive staff. I was very happy with my stay here and would book again on a future visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic accomodations, nice breakfast”
Reviews.Author: WunderLand
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for five nights on business. The room was small, but clean, and I followed other trip advisor recommendations to book an upper floor at the back of the hotel, which did minimize construction/party noise. The beds were very soft, which was comfortable at first, but a little achy after a full night on them. The full breakfast was really a great value since food in th area is expensive. I used the wireless internet quite a bit and there was only one brief time where I had any problems. Everyone who worked at the hotel was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Happy”
Reviews.Author: jpcork
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel located near all places of interest but in a quiet area. We stayed 3 nights sheets changed every day. Buffet breakfast very good too . Staff extremely nice and helpful except one guy the first night who took exception to us having a smoke on steps outside ! We would stay here again for sure. What a city! Red light rocks!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ebbok
Reviews.Content: Great location, very clean, great staff on reception. breakfast v good especially the pancakes. room small basic but very clean and comfy beds everything you need. the only down side was the very early start of the workmen out side but this is not anything anyone could do about this so will not affect my rating

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: tbirdMidWales
Reviews.Content: This hotel was within easy walking distance of all the attractions, but far enough away from the red light district that it wasn't too noisy at night. The breakfast was good, with bacon, eggs, pancakes, cereal, pastries etc, although on one occassion when we got up later, the bacon and eggs were cold. The room was clean and we had no problems with the staff while we were there. There were roadworks out side the front of the hotel, where they were working on the new tube line, but they didn't bother us. In fact they were a bonus, as we quite like 'people watching', and could see all the cranes etc working. We stayed for 3 nights as a long weekend, and this hotel was ideal for what we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing bad.”
Reviews.Author: demidov48
Reviews.Content: Great Location. Average not expencive hotel. Good internet access

Reviews.Title: “Great location, simple, clean, not cheap”
Reviews.Author: cla725
Reviews.Content: I'll avoid an overly verbose review and just write about what were for me the positives and negatives of this hotel: Positives: great location, minutes from the plaza, red light district, canal cruise stop and the train station. Rooms were clean, beds comfortable enough and the maids did an excellent job of cleaning everyday - I say this because i rarely see maids in hotels vacuum daily. Staff was friendly enough and helpful with our inquiries regarding directions, tours. Breakfast was not bad for an inclusive hotel breakfast. Negatives: pricey, quarters are a bit tight and some of the corridors are narrow and staircases small and difficult to traverse with luggage (depends of course on where your room is). Would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: mrsflorencegoh
Reviews.Content: Location: 3 min walk from Dam square; between 2 tram stations; 13 min walk to central train station. Around/opposite the hotel are: small mini supermart, authentic Chinese restaurant, shops selling tourist stuff. The lift reaches the level of my room, so no need to lug luggage up steep stairs. Size of my single room: very small, after the single bed (too soft), toilet, a cupboard and small writing table, there is no space for anything else. Room is quiet and clean. Breakfast: very good - smoked salmon, 3 types of cheeses, eggs cooked in two ways, 6 types of tea, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a minibreak if you're not looking for sheer luxury”
Reviews.Author: Mloclam75
Reviews.Content: Me and 4 friends stayed at the Rokin Hotel last night, having flown over from London to see The Eels at The Paradiso. What we found was an hotel well located for lots of the things to see in Amsterdam, really nice concierges on arrival and departure; comfortable beds and completely adequate rooms - small, but not cramped; no noise at all from back bedrooms, not very much from those at the front and a fantastic breakfast, with a huge selection of 'continental' fayre - breads, cheeses, cold meats and conserves, as well as well-prepared scrambled eggs and bacon. Amsterdam is an expensive city, so unless you're expecting the Ritz (or its equivalent wherever you are), you shouldn't go far wrong!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: DJS23
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. A quiet section on Rokin Street in the busy city centre of Amsterdam. 2 minutes from Dam Square and 10 minutes from Amsterdam Centraal so you can travel anywhere. The service is good and the included breakfast was reasonable. The booking cost also included the city tax so good value for money. The room is basic and there is no coffee/tea making facilities but to be honest Amsterdam has plenty of places to get a decent coffee and more. Leaving bags before and after stay is no trouble as they have a room for baggage and are accommodating. Overall a good experience for what we wanted from Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, small rooms, clean, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: nasos-greece
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife for 3 nights on May 2011. The location was superb, everything in walking distance (shopping, red light district, coffee shops, trams, dam square). The room was very small, we wanted a room with double bed. We saw at first a room with twin bed, which was little bit bigger. Our room was in the back and it was very quiet, but I suppose that rooms in the front might be noisy. The room was also very clean, with private bathroom and LCD-TV equipped. There is an elevator, breakfast (which was included in the price of 125/night) was good enough. The staff was very polite, free wifi was available everywhere (not with good reception everywhere though). Finally our experience was very good, but for such a small room I believe the rent should not be over 100 euros/night.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy, disgusting squat and noisy”
Reviews.Author: nitzer30
Reviews.Content: Not a cheap hotel and we had to endure parties from rooms below. Holes from punches to the doors, cigarette burns everywhere and the breakfast area is ridden with ants. Location is good that is only upside.

Reviews.Title: “A great little find but noise is an issue”
Reviews.Author: JobeeToronto
Reviews.Content: I really wish I could give this hotel five stars. I love it. The location is great. It's a small, quaint place. The post and beam rooms are great. It's clean and comfortable and the staff are wonderful. There is - however - a noise problem. We asked for rooms at the back of the hotel and we could still hear traffic and screaming all night. Not enough to keep us awake, but I can't imagine how noisy the front would be. It's also on a street where they are constructing a subway directly outside which won't be finished until 2015. This creates additional noise as well. Then there is the problem with the noise between rooms. My kids were in the room next to me and I could hear every word they said. Still, if you are a sound sleeper or if you can get a back room, this is a nice place at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “The best budget Hotel that I have stayed at”
Reviews.Author: louisnliz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect location for seeing Amsterdam. I am not a great walker but we only once took a tram - back from the musium quarter- everywhere else was within easy walking distance. The price was reasonable and included free WiFi and breakfast. The breakfast buffet was excellent with a vast choice of sweet and savoury and a choice of breads. The only thing budget about the hotel was the size of the rooms which were not vast but that is to be expected in the city centre where space is at a premium. The only down side is that there are building works outside the front of the hotel - the new Metro - but we were at the back so we only noticed it was there when we arrived at or left the hotel.The staff are very helpful. My brother and his wife wanted a room with a double bed which they did not have on the first night but they moved them to one on the second night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with good location.”
Reviews.Author: CillaN
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at Rokin Hotel and had a very good stay. The rooms seem to have been painted very recently and both rooms and bathrooms are in very good condition. The hotel is situated in walking distance from Amsterdam Central and it was very easy to find with the route description on the webside. The staff is very friendly and helpful The breakfast buffet is not overwhelming, but it's good with several types of bread and various fruit juices. The breakfast was included in the room price when I visited the place. There is short walking distance to the street Spui, which has several good restaurants for dining. (Rokin Hotel has only breakfast restaurant inhouse.) However, Rokin is a street with much traffic even at night time and the tram passes by very frequently, so it's quite noisy. If you have problems with sleeping, bring earplugs to get a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: jenn086
Reviews.Content: Just back, very clean,staff nice,nice breakfast,but road works/underground works at front of hotel can be noisy,they start at 7am.....rooms at back dont have noise problem ! but overall def go back to Rokin next time,very central to most !

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and extremely friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: nairig
Reviews.Content: I've been looking at many hotels online and decided to pick this one based on all the good reviews it had received over the years. The location is good (in city center, walking distance from central station). The hotel staff was very friendly and upon arrival we got to choose a room on the front or backside. We picked the backside, so we would not have noise from the front (although I think there's not a lot of noise, since it's not directly next to the main road). The room was very nice and it was what I expected after seeing the photo's on other websites. My preference for 2 separate beds was honored. The only thing I found weird was that there was no garbage can in the room itself (there was a very small one in the bathroom). I didn't bother to ask the staff for this, since it didn't bother me that much. We had 2 laptops with us and you can get free access to the internet in your room. Only thing "missing" was an outlet to charge our laptops (we had to disconnect a light next to our bed, the only free outlet was next to the door, too far from where we used our laptops). The beds were comfortable enough to get a good night's rest, the room was clean and housekeeping wasn't overly annoying in the morning. Maybe the hotel could supply "DND" signs though. We could hear the other guests in the hallway and heard a few sounds from adjacent rooms, but nothing out of the ordinary. Breakfast was included, but we didn't get up early enough (served until 10.30). We checked out 1 hour late, but the staff didn't make any problem out of this!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very good value”
Reviews.Author: BexSpalding
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff. Basic, but clean, warm room was spacious and at the back of the hotel, so nice and quiet. Mattresses on beds could possibly do with upgrading. Buffet breakfast was very good with some freshly cooked bacon and eggs and pancakes, as well as the usual selection of cold meats/cheeses etc and sweet items. Location is excellent, right in the centre of Amsterdam. For what we paid, this was a good value choice for Amsterdam and we were very happy with our stay here. There is no bar and there was a very limited choice of beverages in a vending machine. Easily rectified by purchasing water etc before heading back to the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, clean & comfy, good location”
Reviews.Author: travelJeanie
Reviews.Content: I onlyl stayed it for 1 night but it was a nice stay. Friendly staff on arrival, clean and comfy twin room. good lcoation for the local attractions. Good breakfast selection available. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Basic bed and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Sologuest
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel inside city centre if you want a no nonsense hotel. Staff at reception is friendly and correct. Staff in breakfast room a bit distant seemingly not aware of guests.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: kevandcatt
Reviews.Content: The Rokin hotel is in a good position, a 10 Min walk from Central station and with Tram stops right outside the front of the hotel, although most of Amsterdam is walkable. We booked 3 rooms for our stay as we were a group of six. We did not get 3 rooms together although this was understandable as the hotel was busy and we checked in at different times. One of us had room 1 which was in the basement with a window right by the steps in to the hotel on the street and were kept awake most of the night by people passing in the street and coming back to the hotel. I would recommend avoiding room 1 for this reason. The other 2 rooms were at the back of the hotel on an upper floor which was much quieter but unfortunately the hotel seemed to be having problems with heating and both rooms were very cold all weekend until Monday morning when we were checking out when the radiators kicked into life. Breakfast is good and the staff on reception helpful. In the scheme of things Rokin is relatively cheap as Central Amsterdam hotels go and apart from the heating problem and Room 1 to be avoided if you just want a cheapish clean hotel it is probably worth considering. The Tara Irish bar a few doors up serves great food and drink. Bar Italia a few doors up is overpriced, has slow poor service and food portions are tiny. One to be avoided unless you like pretentious nouveaux cuisine, and are not very hungry.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location But Too Expensive”
Reviews.Author: Parkerluckystrike
Reviews.Content: Me and my GF stayed at the Rokin hotel, We booked it on-line prior to our arrival, We booked a double bed room (King Size). We arrived at 19:00 which is after the check in time, We got a really tiny room, With no A/C only a fan. The toilet/Shower room was clean but really small. And a wooden beams in the middle of our beds. The ceiling in the shower was really low, I'm 1.78 And it was really hard for me to take a shower. We asked the guy on the front desk to change our room since it's not what we paid for, The answer we got was simply "We are fully booked, But we will change your room tomorrow, After Breakfast." We came back after Breakfast and we got a little bigger room but still really small. It was really clean (With no wooden beam), No bed bugs, The bed was awful...... Very inconvenient!! >>I can sleep better with a sleeping bag on the ground!! We both (Me and my GF) got up every morning with back pains. The breakfast was fine, Normal buffet breakfast i guess.....Nothing special. Good: Breakfast included, Location, 24 Hours front desk staff, Helpful Staff, A computer with internet is available in the lobby for free, Very clean. Bad: Tiny rooms, The water in the shower didn't drain well plus there was a really bad smell coming out the sink. Too Expensive for what you get, You can get a better hotel at this price. No Air Conditioner only a lousy fan. Very thin walls, We could ear everything from the next door. The toilet doesn't flush well!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good hotel but don't expect to sleep........”
Reviews.Author: theselkie
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel with good facilities. The staff were lovely without exception and the place was spotlessly clean. My single room was small but adequate, as was the shower room.However it was very hot and although the fan helped a lot, my window opened onto the eternally busy Rokin and the noise was too much to allow sleep (the fact that it was world cup final weekend which Netherlands happened to be in added to the noise!) However none of this was anyone's fault. My companion was allocated a twin room in the basement which was cooler and a little quieter although he had to put up with the constant noise of people walking around the foyer above him. I have come to accept that hotel rooms in the Netherlands do not have kettles but the cupboard which should have contained the fridge did not. This would have been a huge benefit. Breakfast was the usual Dutch hotel fayre of cheeses, meats, hot bacon and eggs etc. and was good as was the excellent coffee with a huge pot of piping hot milk for the koffie verkeerd. All in all a good hotel in a good location for shopping and sight seeing but don't expect to sleep much if you have a room at the front. Finally, the stairs in the hotel are treacherously(and typically) narrow, steep and spiral so stick to the lift, assuming you have managed up the front steps in the first place. The breakfast room is in the basement with no lift access so be aware of this if arthritis or vertigo are issues for you!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, will return next time i go to Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: JohnBucks
Reviews.Content: The Rokin Hotel is one of the best 3* hotels ive stayed in in Amsterdam and for the price you wont find better in this city. I booked a single room ( not normally advisable in Amsterdam) and i was pleasantly suprised by its size and the execllent bathroom. The hotel was spotless all over, the staff were helpful and friendly,and the real bonus was the inclusive breakfast which was first class and would normally have cost another 20-30 euros in most other hotels. All round a really pleasant stay and I would recommend The Rokin to anyone looking for mid budget accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Location & price and good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: KulkijaHki
Reviews.Content: Good connections, Rokin side rooms lite noisy, but it just midle of town.

Reviews.Title: “right in the Dam sq.”
Reviews.Author: Mellyscookies
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right a short walk from Dam Sq. It's clean and brekfast is good. and it's just what you need to start your long day. There's also a car park in the nearby if you're travelling by car. train station is 5 min away by bus. the rokin hotel is what you deserve to enjoy amsterdam. next to there's an irish pub which serves good dishes.

Reviews.Title: “Roof over your head”
Reviews.Author: jamescunners
Reviews.Content: The Rokin is an absolute gem in an excellent location next to everything you need. The bars, cafes, dam square and red light district are all in walkable distance. I wasnt bothered about anything else but having a bed to stay in as there is plenty more to do in the city of Amsterdam than sit in your hotel room. The rooms were small and the decor wasnt great but you dont go to Amsterdam for 5 star treatment, would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Over-Rated”
Reviews.Author: GTIup
Reviews.Content: I paid â‚¬110 to stay at the Rokin, based mpostly on the reviews from Tripadvisor. Either most of the hotels in Amsterdam - around Centraal Station - are really bad, or this one was over-rated. Certainly not a gem. I purchased a double room (Room 18), because A'dam has such a rep for tiny single bedrooms, and my window looked out to another building 10 feet away, on 3 sides, with a domed window below, No view AT ALL! Well, you could see the sky if you looked up. The room itself was tiny - I had to keep moving a chair around because it either blocked the closet or the pathway to the door. No individual controls of the lights - if you wanted to just read in bed you had to do so with all of the lights on in the room. The bed was ok, although a bit soft. Breakfast was your typical Euro-buffet, except that the sterno had gone out and the eggs & bacon got cold. The "waitress" didn't monitor it, and when I brought it to her attention she fixed me some fresh eggs - scorched - and microwaved the bacon that'd gotten cold - tasted like rubber. TV was a mixture of BBC, Skynews, CNN, a german channel or two, and some Dutch, but there was nothing that I wanted to watch while I was there. The one particularly stand out thing was the free wifi in the room.

Reviews.Title: “great little place”
Reviews.Author: fastandlooney
Reviews.Content: a fantastic little hotel ,centrally located for all the major attractions Amsterdam is a great city ,there is a lot more to it than the red light district and coffee houses the hotel was clean and the beds where as well the staff all spoke English and the breakfast was good the only two things I did lot like were the stairs down to the breakfast room and the hotel did not have a bar may I recommend that you go to the Rembrandt square area for lunch and evening meals (a 5 minuet walk at most) and parking is available at the nearby hotel rho

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice! Ask to turn the neating on before arrival”
Reviews.Author: PasildaX
Reviews.Content: Evi, Greece. I went there with my partner during the New Year holidays 2008. Thanks to Trip Advisor review, we booked a room at the back of the hotel and NOT on the ground floor or the front. When we arrived, our first impression of the reception hall was excellent until we got to our room. It was frozen! Temperatures outside were below zero and we were very disappointed. We immediately complained at the reception and they offered to give us more blankets!!! They said that they were going to send somebody to check it the next morning! The room itself had only ONE radiator but NO HEATING at all in the bathroom. We were told that no bathroom in the hotel had a radiator!The radiator in the room hadn't been turned on for days. Eventually it became habitable 2 days later. Other than, the hotel was an excellent choice, very well located, really central and we didn't have to take any means of transport to see all the sites. It was very clean although the blankets were really worn out. I believe that we got our money's worth and I would definitely recommend it . If you decide to book, just ask them to turn on the heating before you get there.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC LOCATION & DELICIOUS BREAKFAST !!”
Reviews.Author: LOVEPRINCEANDTRAVEL
Reviews.Content: Due to a conference going on in Amsterdam, I found it very difficult to find hotel availability, for our dates. The Rokin, was the last room I could get, so we hoped it would be ok. It was our first time in Amsterdam. On our arrival, we followed the instructions previously given to us. We walked straight ahead from Central Station, through Dam Square, straight on, and we found the hotel a few minutes later (on the left hand side). It is so well located for sightseeing, and amenities. We observed the construction work, going on outside the hotel (this site had already warned us). We checked in without any problem. I had previously emailed the hotel, to ask for a room at the back, which we were given. The work outside wasn't a problem to us. We liked the bedroom and shower room, which was better than we thought it would be. Small, as you would expect in Amsterdam, but very clean. The breakfast is really really nice (yes, i did mean to say "really" twice!) A nice choice of buffet, there was a lovely lady on duty (sorry, we didn't get her name). She kindly cooked fried eggs for us, even though they aren't usually on the menu. (You were lovely, thank you!) The breakfast room is in the basement, and it is so clean, bright and homely !! The kitchen is attached, and also very clean. We enjoyed our stay at this hotel and recommend that others do too. We loved Amsterdam, our visit to Anne Franks house, was a very moving one. The canals and houses were beautiful. This wonderful City is very diverse, with a vibrant atmosphere, and everyone speaks English so well !!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value”
Reviews.Author: TJ10Warrington
Reviews.Content: 23/24 June 2008. My husband and I were quite impressed by the Rokin Hotel. Having booked a fairly low budget place to stay, we found it to be very friendly, our room was spotless and comfortable (although quite small) and very well supplied buffet breakfast included. If you are booking in the near future you need to ensure that you have a room at the back of the hotel as there are major works going on at the front for the tunnelling of a new metro system.

Reviews.Title: “Too much for too little at the Rokin Hotel”
Reviews.Author: warrenUk
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at the Rokin, and on this occasion I would say it was worse. I fully understand that this hotel is in a very good location, and that hotels in Amsterdam are generally quite expensive. But this hotel is really too pricey for what you get. And on this occasion, we got a bathroom that smelt of blocked drains most of the time (potentially acknowledged by staff whom kept leaving the skylight opening during cleaning the room to get some fresh air circulating), we got pillow cases with holes, and pretty threadbare towels. The room was cleaned to a high standard however throughout the time we stayed there. The breakfast was barely satisfactory at best, and our last morning, we asked for a taxi to take us to Schipol airport. I know that taxi fares are unregulated in Amsterdam, but to have links with a taxi firm that charges up to Â£40 for a one way run to Schipol is not the best way to keep customers happy - a kindly warning on fare charging might have been helpful? Generally however, staff were approachable during our stay. Overall, NOT worth over Â£100 sterling A NIGHT! A shame, as given the location, a few changes to current practice would make this hotel ideal.........................and justify the prices charged.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, bad service”
Reviews.Author: patelv01
Reviews.Content: The rokin hotel has an excellent location near Dam square. The rooms are a good size and breakfast was included. Out stay was OK, but we found the front desk staff to be unhelpful. Our room (10) had a view of a flat roof and when we asked for a better view, he just said we are fully booked in an unhelpful manner. Addtionally we had mosquito's in our room which bit me and my wife on our first night. I've been to Amsterdam numerous times in the past, but have never seen Mosquito's there!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but seems overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Andrew9
Reviews.Content: The location of Hotel Rokin is excellent. You are less than 10 minutes by foot from Central Station, a couple of minutes from the Red Light District, and 20 minutes walk from Leidseplein. As other have mentioned substantial roadwork is going on outside - or was back in March. It was the weekend and I didn't notice any noise or even work activity so it wasn't a problem accept it was a bit awkward walking round the construction to get to the front of the hotel from the other side of the road. The staff were all friendly and helpful. Breakfast was better than most economy hotels in Amsterdam. The room was awfully narrow but that's not uncommon in Amsterdam. At least it was well kept and clean. The shower was almost useless. Getting a warm water shower was very difficult. A scolding hot or freezing cold one is no problem! I've stayed in lots of hotels in Amsterdam over the years. This one isn't the best but it's also far from the worst. But even considering that it's not as bad as others I've stayed in the price gap between Rokin and the others seemed out of whack. It seems to be about 15 or 20 euro too much per night. Maybe that's why I was able to get a weekend room at the last minute. normally difficult to do in that area of Amsterdam. That said, I'd stay here again. But I'd look around for a cheaper place before settling for this one.

Reviews.Title: “street noise”
Reviews.Author: benmcc
Reviews.Content: this hotel is fairly good apart from a VERY VERY NOISY street at night and day with roadworks going on. i wouldnt stay here again unless i was guaranteed a quiet room at the back of the building, Otherwise , the hotel is well run and clean, and the breakfast is good. if you are walking to the hotel from dam square at night beware of junkies hanging around the archway leading to rokin (street) .

Reviews.Title: “Ok but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Mike_Devon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location, not far from Dam Square. The rooms are fine, breakfast adequate. However, I thought it was a bit overpriced for what it was.

Reviews.Title: “Functional rather than flash”
Reviews.Author: PJMH
Reviews.Content: Probably the best thing about this hotel is it's location, less than a five minutes walk from Dam Square. I was travelling solo for one night so found this place to be ideal, generally basic and functional. My room (19) had a single bed and was clean, TV etc but no hot drinks making kit, but that's not the end of the world, you very much get what you pay for and as this was just a place to kip I wasn't too fussy. The bathroom was fine and clean with a shower (no bath). Oddly the windows in the bedroom were too far up the wall to see out of, so I can't tell you about the view. The breakfast, which was included in the price was quite good really, cereals, bacon and scrambled egg, toast, fruit, cheese etc. tea/coffee, juice etc. Very welcome it was too. I was in Amsterdam to smoke at my favourite coffee shops and sparked up a couple in the room without any difficulty, so if you're in the city for a smoke etc then I didn't have any trouble doing so here (although of course it may not be hotel policy so just be sensible about it!) So all in all, the entire place is functional rather than flash or luxurious, but if you want a good, budget, well located, clean hotel with friendly helpful staff then this is the place for you. I booked through bookings.nl and paid E105 for a single room for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Just the job”
Reviews.Author: Fly-by-Knight
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights 4-8th February. Traveling solo, I got Room 28, with a double bed, shower and toilet. Spotlessly clean, warm, and whilst pretty tight for space if all you want to do is have somewhere clean and dry to stop overnight, then this place is just the job. It is ten minutes walk from the Central Station, itself an easy and cheap (3.60 euros) ride from Schipol. Just come straight out of the station, and go down the main drag to Dam Square, across the Square bearing slightly left and carry on and the hotel is on the LHS marked out with an uninspiring lit sign. In fact, seeing this my heart sank a bit, but the inside is much much better than the outside, and reception is fine, the staff helpful, (happily kept cases on the last day to 1800hrs) and the room was - as previously mentioned - fine unless you want to swing a cat. There was a TV that got CNN and BBC, plus a load of other channels, and a safe in the room too. The only downside for some (though I couldn't care less) is that the view was a non-event over roofs and service ducts etc - but I travel to get out and about, so no problem there for me! Breakfast is included, and was a comprehensive collection of breads, meats, cheese, cereals, fruit, fruit juices, with the hot element considting of scrambled egg, and fairly crispy bacon. Not cordon bleu stuff, but all I wanted, and set me up for the day to dinner. The location is great, in fact could hardly be bettered really, with everything within a half-hour walk for the reasonably fit, and loads of stuff within a few minutes. Didn't bother with the trams - by the time you've figured out which one goes where and then waited for it, you might as well walk. In conclusion, if you are aiming to have a good look round Amsterdam without spending a fortune, the Rokin is just the job!

Reviews.Title: “Small but comfy with a great location”
Reviews.Author: christalee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after I had reached my limit with hostel accommodation (sometimes its just great to come back and crash in your own room). I chose the hotel primarily due to its location - close to the heart of bustling Amsterdam and the red light district - and its reasonable prices. My room was on the top floor, the elevator took you to floor 3 and then you walked a short flight of stairs to reach the final floor. The room itself was small - but as a solo traveller this was fine. I am not sure how the room size would suit a couple, however. They may use alternate rooms for double occupancy. Bed was comfortable and bathroom, whilst compact, was adequate. I found that despite the hotels location off a busy road, that there was minimal traffic noise. I was happy with my stay here and as I was catching a train back to the airport the following day was appreciative of the close proximity to the station. Very little to criticise, pleasant stay in reasonably priced and reasonably presented accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: NorfolkLassie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Rokin on a short break in September. There is nothing we can fault. Reception very friendly and helpful. The breakfasts were wonderful with a huge variety, all freshly cooked. We are looking forward to going back. We would thoroughly recommend this hotel but beware you need to be able bodied as there are steps up to the hotel and very steep steps down to the dining room.

Reviews.Title: “Rokin Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: Clairehamm
Reviews.Content: Oh wow! My boyfriend took me to Amsterdam to celebrate my birthday and this year we made a great choice with the hotel, thanks to a great review on TripAdvisor. The hotel was in a fab location, breakfast was good and plentiful, the room was cleaned everyday, it was lovely and quiet (stay at the back of the hotel) and the staff were helpful and friendly. It was in a great part of town and it meant that we stayed away from the sleazy, overpriced and slightly scary areas of the Dam. I think this hotel was a real bargain and I am looking forward to staying here. Um, to add one minor complaint, they need pay per view or better channels, when you wanted to relax after a day drinking coffee(!) you need some rubbish to watch.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: TravellingFinn
Reviews.Content: Stayed the 3 night without kids. Perfect hotel for a weekend in Amsterdam. Reasonable priced, excellent location. Breakfast above average. Rooms are tiny, but clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, So-So Hotel”
Reviews.Author: roup1
Reviews.Content: Yes, the location is perfect - just steps from Dam Square. However, there are some downsides to this little gem. I wasn't expecting a very big room and I got what I expected! Yes, most rooms in AMS are small, but this one seemed smaller than most. The bathroom was tiny and the shower was in the middle of the bathroom (no stall or tub,) Everything in the bathroom got soaking wet! The breakfast was barely edible. The staff seemed friendly enough. I could not get any wi-fi in my room and had to bring my laptop down to lobby to connect to ethernet port at 5.00 Euros/hour.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good and 'strategic' location!”
Reviews.Author: pit76
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my staying in Amsterdam with my girlfriend at Rokin Hotel, it was very nice and comfortable both for the location and for the accomodation: very nice room, clean and comfortable to reach for the lift!!!Very very good the breakfast served!!!We didn't dine and so I can't give an advise about it. The hotel is in the "real" city centre, 10 minutes walk from central station, 2 from Dam Square and 4 from Rembrandt Square, Flowers Market on the Singel canal. Then the tram stop is in front of the hotel!The location is in a very central and known street but at the same time very quiet, far from the "noises" of pubs, restaurants and people!Very kind the hotel staff!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great little Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Amsterdam for 3 nights with my friend to celebrate our 40th birthdays. We would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone. The location is excellent - 10 minutes walk from Central Station and 5 minutes from Dam Square and the Red Light district, however it is not noisy and we felt safe. Don't be put-off by first appearances. There are lots of cranes and building work on the road - its not pretty -but there was no evidence of any work going on during our visit, however, it was ridiculously hot so maybe they were having a rest! There are lots of "interesting" adult shops nearby, loads selling tourist tat but there are also some really good shopping areas all within walking distance of the hotel.Try turning left out of the hotel for a change of scenery. The hotel is spotlessly clean and provides a good breakfast. Our room was on the ground floor and at the back. We had a view of the wall of the next building, however, it was quiet and cool which was fantastic as the temperature soared. The room had a safe (no charge) ,hairdryer, TV and phone and was very clean and comfortable. The towels were changed every day and a much appreciated electric fan was provided, again no charge. The hotel has 24 hour reception service and felt very safe. We had a great weekend in this lively, bustling city. You can immerse yourself in the art and culture or you can have a lot of fun, eating, shoppng, drinking and watching the world go by. Don't expect to come back rested but for a good time it would be hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Good, nice and cheap”
Reviews.Author: RigodÃ³n
Reviews.Content: Hi All, This little hotel was a surprise, 300 metres from Dam Square, in front of a TRAM/Bus Stop, in a typical building (With wooden beams in the rooms). My previous hotel in Amsterdam was NH Krasnapolsky (Twice) but, in the future I will prefer Rokin Hotel (Almost Half Price). The most incredible was the breakfast, absolutely wonderful, even better than other 4**** hotels. The cook is pending to serve the buffet and you can see the kitchen from your desk (Such as your own home). Definitively, very recommendable for spend a weekend in Amsterdam. PROS: Price, Location, Breakfast, a real amsterdam building. CONS: Not wheelchair suitable, Noisy (Public Works in front of the hotel -March2006-). Beds.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, great location!”
Reviews.Author: JonnaFinland
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Rokin for three nights with my sister. We really liked the hotel! The breakfast was delicious and the staff was very very friendly and helpful. The room was pretty small but nice and it was cleaned every day. Our plane left late at night and it was possible to leave the luggage into the hotel for the day so we didn't have to take our luggage with us to the city. The location is awesome, right next to the Dam square! There is also a really nice shopping street close to the hotel and the Flower Market is not too far away either. The only bad thing was the noise of the front street. It would be better to ask for room on back of hotel. Although it didn't bother us too much. If you are looking for a nice small hotel with friendly staff and good price, you should go for it!

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel”
Reviews.Author: Gary06
Reviews.Content: This little canal house hotel is a jewel. If you want a small inexpensive and very clean hotel, this is it. The rates including breakfast can't be beat. This is basic accommodations, no frills, with a great location within walking distance of everything. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “So Central, So Clean So Accessible, Staff so Nice, Hotel Great Value”
Reviews.Author: PartyAnimalDublin
Reviews.Content: I can't rate this hotel high enough from cleanliness, to being so central to the city its perfect if you want cheap and cheerful. Rooms are small but all you're doing in them is sleeping in them and they're soooo clean. Most trams pass outside the hotel so you can access any tourist attraction by jumping on one down to the Central station and transferring. Its soo easy. Room rates are very reasonable which also includes breakfast served up to 10.30am

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel with good location!”
Reviews.Author: Blue_moo_cow
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for myself and 5 of my friends. We were in Amsterdam for the new years eve celebrations. We got to the hotel which is very well located off Dam Square. The only problem with check in was that I had specifically asked for smoking rooms and one of the single rooms was non smoking. The lady on reception was very helpful though and said she wouldn't tell if we didn't! :o) We stayed here for 3 nights and it was very pleasant indeed. I had a double room which was a good size by amsterdam terms and clean with a good shower room. One of my friends who had the single room was on the very top floor, even further up than where the lift goes. He was in the roof part and the eves were quite Claustrophobic. This was a very small room!! The breakfast was a buffet and was great! Overall this is a good hotel with helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “New improved Rokin?”
Reviews.Author: kmherself
Reviews.Content: First stayed here some time ago, and hotel is now better since refurbishment - nice to have a lift after staying in Amsterdam hotels without one! Reasonably priced for its very convenient and central location. Breakfast was excellent and rooms clean. Only problem we had was with the location of our room - we were given room 6 on our first night, and this room is almost subterranean, with the only natural light coming in through a skylight! Perhaps after the refurb they are now using spaces which elsewhere would be storage or kitchen space, rather than accommodation. After complaining, we were moved to a room with a window, which was a huge improvement. Would happily recommend overall, but perhaps those booking online as we did should check they are getting a room with a window.

Reviews.Title: “Good facilities, awful unhelpful rude staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Rokin is centrally located...but the construction out the front which will continue well in to 2005 means it is very inconvenient to get to and from. The hotel facilities are great...but they are overshadowed by the staff who are incredibly unhelpful and unwelcoming. My friend checking in one day before me meant that I was made to wait an unacceptable amount of time before I was admitted entrance to the room that had been booked in my name. An original request for a twin room was ignored and we were given a double. A further request to rectify this was deemed too hard and inconvenient and postponed until the following day. Despite being promised a change of room, I had to call and organise it again with a different member of staff. Simple things like handing over keys became a chore when faced with the sour, dour and rude nature of the staff. The hotel enforced a 'visitors policy' so visitors were only allowed in hotel rooms for 1 hour. This was subsequently changed by another member of staff and we were told that visitors were not allowed at all. I was accused of trying to 'smuggle' people in to my room, and of 'hiding' people in there when in reality, I was in there alone. All in all, the hotel itself is let down by its staff. I have never stayed in a hotel like it - where the staff seem to go out of their way to make your stay unpleasant as possible. Go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice friendly hotel, even better second time around!”
Reviews.Author: BrightonBoi77
Reviews.Content: Have to say we were very impressed with this hotel now that the renovation has been completed. Nice room with en-suite shower room, really clean and a better breakfast in the new lower ground floor breakfast room. Staff were all very friendly, we have stayed here before the renovations and it was a bit rough around the edges, however now that everything has been refurbished I would certainly recommend it for location/comfort, average price (not as cheap as it was), and decent breakfast! We shall stay here again on our next visit, we will try for rooms at the rear of the building though as the front is quite noisy with the building of the underground link past the front of the building which has been going on for at least 18months now, and the trams/traffic going past till the early hours... Oh, and forget the steep stairs you previously had to climb, there is now a brand spanking new posh lift to all but the top floor! :o)

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: rondub
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Rokin Hotel recently for a couple of nights in a single room. I found that the room was small and the window was in an odd position, high up on the wall, not offering much light. However the rooms were nicely decorated and very clean. The loation is also good, just down from Dam square. So if you are looking for something close to the center, just to lay your head - this place is fine. One bit of advice - Ask for room on back of hotel, because the street out the front is very busy and noisy, with constant roadworks.

Reviews.Title: “oh my god”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: although we had a fantastic stay it was nothing to do with the rokin hotel. when we arrived we discovered the hotel was being renovated and we had been allocated a different hotel, the rho hotel which was extremely comfortable. the bathroom was a good size, the room was small but adequate, sky tv, excellent breakfast and right on dam square

HotelInfo.Name: Rokin Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Rokin 73, Amsterdam 1012 KL, The Netherlands
